GET /radar/attacks/layer3/summary.description: Percentage distribution of network protocols in layer 3/4 attacks over a given time period.

schema.description: Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.
Array of comma separated list of locations (alpha-2 country codes). Start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-US,PT` excludes results from the US, but includes results from PT.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/attacks/layer3/summary/bitrat.description: Percentage distribution of attacks by bitrate.

schema.description: Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of locations (alpha-2 country codes). Start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-US,PT` excludes results from the US, but includes results from PT.
Filter for ip version.
Array of L3/4 attack types.
Together with the `location` parameter, will apply the filter to origin or target location.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/attacks/layer3/timeseries.description: Get attacks change over time by bytes.

schema.description: Aggregation interval results should be returned in (for example, in 15 minutes or 1 hour intervals). Refer to [Aggregation intervals](https://developers.cloudflare.com/radar/concepts/aggregation-intervals/).
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.
Array of comma separated list of locations (alpha-2 country codes). Start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-US,PT` excludes results from the US, but includes results from PT.
Filter for ip version.
Array of L3/4 attack types.
Normalization method applied. Refer to [Normalization methods](https://developers.cloudflare.com/radar/concepts/normalization/).
Measurement units, eg. bytes.
Together with the `location` parameter, will apply the filter to origin or target location.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/attacks/layer3/top/attacks.description: Get the top attacks from origin to target location. Values are a percentage out of the total layer 3 attacks (with billing country). You can optionally limit the number of attacks per origin/target location (useful if all the top attacks are from or to the same location).

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of locations (alpha-2 country codes). Start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-US,PT` excludes results from the US, but includes results from PT.
Filter for ip version.
Array of L3/4 attack types.
Array of attack origin/target location attack limits. Together with `limitPerLocation`, limits how many objects will be fetched per origin/target location.
Limit the number of attacks per origin/target (refer to `limitDirection` parameter) location.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/attacks/layer7/top/ases/origi.description: Get the top origin ASes by layer 7 attacks. Values are a percentage out of the total layer 7 attacks. The origin location is determined by the client IP.

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of locations (alpha-2 country codes).
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/attacks/layer7/top/ases/origi.summary: Get Top Origin Autonomous Systems By Layer 7 Attacks

GET /radar/attacks/layer7/top/attacks.description: Get the top attacks from origin to target location. Values are a percentage out of the total layer 7 attacks (with billing country). The attack magnitude can be defined by the number of mitigated requests or by the number of zones affected. You can optionally limit the number of attacks per origin/target location (useful if all the top attacks are from or to the same location).

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of locations (alpha-2 country codes). Start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-US,PT` excludes results from the US, but includes results from PT.
Attack magnitude can be defined by total requests mitigated or by total zones attacked.
Array of attack origin/target location attack limits. Together with `limitPerLocation`, limits how many objects will be fetched per origin/target location.
Limit the number of attacks per origin/target (refer to `limitDirection` parameter) location.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/attacks/layer7/top/attacks.summary: Get Top Attack Pairs (origin and target locations) By Layer 7 Attacks

GET /radar/attacks/layer7/top/locations/.description: Get the top origin locations of and by layer 7 attacks. Values are a percentage out of the total layer 7 attacks. The origin location is determined by the client IP.

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/attacks/layer7/top/locations/.summary: Get Top Origin Locations By Layer 7 Attacks

GET /radar/attacks/layer7/top/locations/.description: Get the top target locations of and by layer 7 attacks. Values are a percentage out of the total layer 7 attacks. The target location is determined by the attacked zone's billing country, when available.

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Format results are returned in.
